content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <codeBook xsi:schemaLocation="ddi:codebook:2_5 http://www.ddialliance.org/Specification/DDI-Codebook/2.5/XMLSchema/codebook.xsd" version="2.5" xmlns="ddi:codebook:2_5" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">   <docDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>DDI2.5 XML CODEBOOK RECORD FOR STUDY NUMBER 851571</titl>       </titlStmt>       <prodStmt>         <prodDate></prodDate>       </prodStmt>     </citation>   </docDscr>   <stdyDscr>     <citation>       <titlStmt>         <titl>Deprivation-adjusted distance-weighted local P* exposure indices of socio-economic inequality for South Africa</titl>         <IDNo agency="UKDA">851571</IDNo>         <IDNo agency="datacite">10.5255/UKDA-SN-851571</IDNo>       </titlStmt>       <rspStmt>         <AuthEnty>David McLennan, University of Oxford</AuthEnty>         <othId>Michael Noble</othId>         <othId>Benjamin J. Roberts</othId>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <copyright>David McLennan, University of Oxford</copyright>         <fundAg>ESRC</fundAg>         <grantNo>ES/I034889/1v</grantNo>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <depositr>David McLennan, University of Oxford</depositr>         <distDate date="2014-11-14T00:00:00Z">14 November 2014</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2015-03-02T00:00:00Z">Rvs31</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-851571" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>SPATIAL</keyword>         <keyword>INEQUALITY</keyword>         <keyword>RESIDENTIAL SEGREGATION</keyword>         <keyword>POVERTY</keyword>         <keyword>DEPRIVATION</keyword>         <keyword>SOUTH AFRICA</keyword>         <keyword>CENSUS</keyword>         <keyword>2014</keyword>         <topcClas>Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The dataset consists of two exposure indices which were developed to reflect people's lived experience of inequality in South Africa. The two indices measure exposure to socio-economic inequality from the perspectives of the 'poor' and the 'non-poor', respectively. Both exposure indices are presented at 'Datazone' neighbourhood level and are based on data derived from the South African 2001 Census.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2011-10-01T00:00:00Z">01 October 2011</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2014-04-30T00:00:00Z">30 April 2014</collDate>         <nation>South Africa</nation>         <geogCover>South Africa</geogCover>         <geogUnit>Other</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>geographic units</anlyUnit>         <dataKind>Numeric</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <collMode>Mapping and spatial statistical analysis</collMode>         <sources />       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <contact><a href="mailto:david.mclennan@spi.ox.ac.uk">David McLennan, University of Oxford</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat />   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
